pages.text: Similar to the Universal Cable, the Thermodynamic Conductor is Mekanism's way of transmitting heat energy (essentially a heat pipe).$(2br)Transfer is lossy, depending on the biome the conductor is in. Warmer biomes (such as deserts) have a higher transfer efficiency (less heat is lost), while colder biomes (such as snow tundras) have a lower transfer efficiency (more

heat is lost). It is also advised to not make a long Thermodynamic Conductor network since the longer the network is, the more heat is lost.$(p)Like other transmission pipes, they can be configurated to be Push, Pull, None, or Normal by $(k:sneak) + right clicking on the connected bits with a $(l:item/configurator)Configurator$(/l).

$(bold)Redstone Sensitivity$(br)$()By right clicking on a Thermodynamic Conductor with a $(l:item/tools/configurator)Configurator$(/l), you can toggle Redstone Sensitivity on/off. When toggled $(bold)on$(), the Thermodynamic Conductor will interact with redstone signals. If the Thermodynamic Conductor is in contact with an active redstone signal, it will disconnect from any surrounding blocks/pipes. It stays this way until the redstone signal is gone. By default, Redstone Sensitivity is toggled off.
